answers.answer: Unless your doctor says otherwise. The recommended weight gain is different for everyone. I am 5'3" and weighed 278 before I got pregnant. With a mixture of severe morning sickness, sleeping most of the time and walking when I could I lost 34 pounds my first 15 weeks. I am now 31 weeks and only gained 5 pounds since I was 15 weeks. However my doctor does not want me gaining too much more weight. Your doctor will let you know if s/he is concerned about your weight.

I have a friend that just had her baby he was 7lbs and 19in before she got pregnant she weighed 95 pounds n at 20 weeks she was already at 125 n at the end she was 145 she gained a lot. Yea she gained a little to much bit she was still healthy n so was the baby. I think as long as u dnt have high blood pressure or diabetes n ur baby is healthy u should be fine.

question: im 4'11 & 26 weeks pregnant .and before i got pregnant i used to weigh 90 or 100 lbs and on my last check up i weigh 132 lbs , and i went on Monday and i was 134 . is that okay ?
title: is that okay ?
